author: Maggie Reilly
title: Beautiful weekend ahead with sunshine, dry conditions, and mild temperatures
text: Happy Friday! Today through Sunday skies will be mostly sunny and conditions will be dry with pleasant late December temperatures. Highs will be in the 40s and mid to upper 30s. Also, not much wind for these three days as sustained wind speeds will generally be between 5 and 15 mph. New Year’s Day skies will be partly cloudy to mostly sunny with a slight chance of rain and snow. High temperatures will be in the low to mid 40s and winds will be a bit breezy with sustained wind speeds between 5 and 20 mph. Tuesday will be partly cloudy with some isolated snow showers around, generally in the mountains and along the eastern half of the Hi-Line, as a disturbance passes through our area. A little cooler with highs in the mid to upper 30s and low 40s, and a little breezy with sustained wind speeds between 5 and 20 mph. Wednesday will be partly to mostly cloudy with a slight chance of snow showers. High temperatures will be in the mid to upper 30s. Thursday will be partly to mostly sunny with a slight chance of snow. High temperatures will range in the 30s.

author: @KGNSnews
title: American Red Cross ‘Sound the Alarm’ campaign aims to save lives in Webb County
text: American Red Cross ‘Sound the Alarm’ campaign aims to save lives in Webb County WEBB COUNTY, TX (KGNS) - The American Red Cross is doing its best to make sure Webb Couty residents are safe from any potential house fires. As part of the “Sound the Alarm” campaign, the Red Cross will be installing free smoke detectors for county residents who live in all areas of Webb County. Every year, officials and volunteers with the Red Cross go to different houses to replace old or broken smoke detectors with new devices. Judith Mena, the disaster program manager for the Red Cross said that with each smoke detector that they install, the hope is to potentially save lives. “We can install from four and on, so and everything is completely free, so there is no charge for anything, and you are also provided with a small education class for other incidents like a flood and things like that.” If you would like to request a free smoke alarm, Mena asks that you call 210-582-1962. The organization plans to start installing smoke detectors on March 23. For more headlines. click [here](https://www.kgns.tv/news/local). Copyright 2024 KGNS. All rights reserved.

author: Diana Serbe
title: Traum vom Auswandern zerplatzt: Ex-GZSZ-Star redet Tacheles
text:
Traum vom Auswandern zerplatzt: Ex-GZSZ-Star redet Tacheles
Das Auf und Ab einer Auswanderung erlebte auch eine bekannte Ex-GZSZ-Darstellerin, die ihr Scheitern anfangs als massives Versagen ansah.
Berlin – Auswandern ist für Hunderttausende Deutsche jedes Jahr ein Lebensziel, das sie endlich umsetzen. Darunter sind auch zahlreiche Prominente. Nicht immer verläuft alles wie in der Vorstellung, meist erschweren ungeplante Hürden das Leben in der neuen Heimat. Das musste auch eine Ex-GZSZ-Schauspielerin feststellen. Sie entschied sich dafür, nach Deutschland zurückzukehren.
Ex-GZSZ-Star Isabell Horn unglücklich mit Auswanderung nach Schweden
Für Auswanderer gibt es viele Traumziele. Während es immer mehr Prominente wie Ex-„Tagesschau“-Sprecher Jan Hofer (75) oder „Traumschiff“-Darstellerin Collien Ulmen-Fernandes (43) auf die spanische Insel Mallorca zieht, gibt es für Deutsche noch ein Traumziel im Norden: Schweden. Der Traum von Bullerbü holte auch Ex-GZSZ-Darstellerin Isabell Horn (41) ein. Von 2009 bis 2014 spielte sie in der Vorabend-Telenovela die flippige Pia Koch, die sie auch von 2015 bis 2016 in der RTL-Serie „Alles was zählt“ spielte. Dann wurde es ruhiger um die gebürtige Bielefelderin.
Ihr Buch gibt Aufschluss darüber, warum. In „Bleibt das jetzt so? Die Depression, mein unperfektes Leben und ich“ erzählt sie offen von psychischen Problemen. Ein Leben in einem anderen Land sollte womöglich auch einen Neuanfang für den Kopf bringen. Im Sommer 2023 wanderte die Schauspielerin mit ihrem Partner Jens Ackermann (40) und den gemeinsamen Kindern Ella (8) und Fritz (5) nach Schweden aus. Zunächst hat das Paar wieder mehr zusammengefunden, doch dann bereiteten einige Herausforderungen der Familie Schwierigkeiten.
Ex-GZSZ-Star Isabell Horn hielt Sprachbarriere für großes Problem der Auswanderer
Vor allem die Sprache habe das Sozialleben eingeschränkt. „Ich hatte Hemmungen, konnte mich kaum verständigen“, verriet Isabell Horn gegenüber Closer. „Ich habe mich immer isoliert gefühlt.“ Obwohl Englisch in Schweden weit verbreitet ist, sei es ohne Schwedischkenntnisse schwer, Kontakte zu den Einheimischen zu knüpfen. Einfach mal so ein Plausch im Supermarkt sei nicht möglich gewesen. Auch die Sehnsucht nach Familie und Freunden war groß. Zu RTL sagte die Schauspielerin: „Ich hatte dann auch das Gefühl: Okay, jetzt haben wir hier komplett versagt. Ich wollte nicht so schnell aufgeben.“
Doch der Entschluss stand fest: Die Rückwanderung nach Deutschland sollte nach nur anderthalb Jahren Schweden kommen. Nun ist die Familie zurück in Berlin, was sich „einerseits vertraut, andererseits total fremd“ anfühle, so Horn zu Closer. Den ihren Kindern fehlen der Wald und die Tiere Schwedens, dafür hätten sie ihre alten Freunde in der Schule wieder. Auch Isabells Freundinnen sind nur einen Katzensprung entfernt. Partner Jan pendelte ohnehin nach Berlin für den Job. Auch wenn die Idee für den dauerhaften Wohnsitz vorbei ist, als Urlaubsland soll Schweden der Familie erhalten bleiben.
Mit ihrem Grundstück in Berlin, das sie während der Zeit in Schweden behielten, wollen sie sich bald den Traum vom Eigenheim verwirklichen. Aus der Serien-Familie gibt es weitere glückliche Nachrichten: Ein GZSZ-Darsteller konnte sich trotz Krebs den Traum vom Elterndasein verwirklichen. Verwendete Quellen: rtl.de, „Closer“ (Ausgabe 19/2025)

author: Rida Shahid
title: Punjab CM Announces Bonus for LWMC’s Christian Staff for Easter
text:
In a heartwarming gesture, Punjab’s Chief Minister, Maryam Nawaz Sharif, has declared a special Easter bonus for the Christian employees of the Lahore Waste Management Company (LWMC). This announcement comes as a part of the Good Friday and Easter celebrations.
The CM has declared a bonus of Rs5000 for each Christian employee. The LWMC’s HR department has confirmed this in an official notification. As per the notification, the bonus will benefit 9199 sanitary workers, 73 supervisors, 250 drivers, and 6 helpers.
In addition to this, a comprehensive zero waste operation will be carried out across the city before the Good Friday holiday. LWMC’s CEO, Babar Din, has assured that all workers will put in extra hours in the field to ensure the cleaning of the city’s 266 churches before the Easter celebrations.
Special attention will be given to the 78 Christian Colonies where manual sweeping and scraping processes will be carried out. The operational machinery will be active in the field on both Good Friday and Easter.
CEO Babar Sahib Din has called upon the citizens to support the LWMC staff in their efforts to keep the city clean. He reiterated the importance of cleanliness and urged the citizens to do their part in maintaining the city’s cleanliness during the Easter celebrations.

author: Daily Times Leader
title: Moravera Music Presents an Evening of Soul-Stirring Country Gospel With Andy E McGuire and Band at The Rockmart Theater | User | dailytimesleader.com
text: ROME, GA / ACCESSWIRE / March 29, 2024 / Prepare your hearts for a musical journey that promises to uplift and inspire at The Rockmart Theater on Saturday, April 6, 2024, presented by Moravera Music, one of Georgia's leading live music entertainment, music production and artist development agencies. Andy E McGuire, a highly acclaimed artist in the country gospel genre, will take the stage with his talented band for a live concert event that's set to be an unforgettable evening of heart-rending melodies and uplifting harmonies. The concert will commence at 7 p.m., doors open at 6 p.m., at the historic venue located at 116 East Elm Street, Rockmart, Georgia, offering audiences a unique blend of spiritual lyrics and country rhythm. Leading the charge alongside McGuire is a lineup of exceptional musicians, each bringing their own flair to the stage. Elton Griffin's soul-stirring percussion promises to get audiences tapping along while Carlos Wilhelm's virtuoso guitar creates resonant riffs that speak directly to the spirit. Levi White's melodic bass grooves provide a solid musical foundation and Lynn Hicks' skilled keyboard-playing adds depth and emotion, completing a musical ensemble that transcends genres. As a Special Guest, the talented Antioch Praise and Worship Band will be joining the stage on this musical journey. Tickets for this extraordinary concert are now available, with adult passes priced at $10 and kids' tickets (under 12) at just $5. This is a rare opportunity to experience country gospel music's powerful and inspirational sounds in a live setting, making it a must-attend event for music lovers of all ages. In addition to the concert, fans and newcomers alike are invited to join in the celebration of the music video release for "All Mighty God," a poignant track from Andy E McGuire. This song is a touching tribute to his mother's brave fight against Alzheimer's disease, showcasing the unbreakable bond between mother and son. The music video is a visually captivating journey through love, faith, and resilience, reminding viewers of the higher purpose awaiting us beyond our struggles. Don't miss this night of music that promises to inspire and uplift. Secure tickets now for an evening with Andy E McGuire and his band at The Rockmart Theater - a celebration of faith, hope, and country gospel that will resonate long after the final note is played. About 'All Mighty God' Music Video Experience the emotional depth of "All Mighty God," a song that encapsulates the journey of love, faith, and the unyielding spirit of resilience. Andy E McGuire's latest music video is a testament to the power of music to move and uplift, inviting viewers to share in a story of profound personal significance. This music video is not just a song, but a message of hope and strength to all who watch it. Contact Information Merari Morales-Rivera Marketing Manager [moraveramusic@gmail.com](mailto:moraveramusic@gmail.com) 7063024563 SOURCE: Moravera Music View the original press release on newswire.com.
